titleStmt.title: Request for Wreaths
titleStmt.author: (Unnamed) kourepistoularios of the praeses of Arcadia

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: (1st hand) (Cross) Office of the curator of the letters of his eminence my lord, vir spectabilis, comes of the sacred consistory, governor of the province of Arcadia, to the ekdikos and ripiarii of the Oxyrhynchite (nome).;(2nd hand) When you receive this letter, please compel Dionysios, who is deputy logistes of (the city) of the Oxyrhynchites, to dispatch at his own risk wreaths from the public market of Herakleopolis - the price of which he is also to deliver in full to this office - and no less compel also Philoxenos, the protodemotes and . . ., so that the baskets of the . . . [- - -];;(In left margin: Latin docket, 3rd hand) Issued on the 10th day before the Kalends of January at Heracleopolis

listBibl.bibl: Hanson AE, PMich XVIII, 794, 1996, Pl. XL -- -- BL XI, 135 (l. 1)
